post.body:
The 12th century Tibetan Buddhist master Gampopa said:

>Sexual misconduct has three categories: sex proscribed by family ties, sex proscribed by belonging to someone else, and sex proscribed due to religious factors. The first of these is intercourse with parents, siblings, and so forth [blood relations]. The second is intercourse with someone committed to another person or belonging to a monarch. The third includes five areas of improper intercourse because of organs involved, place, time, degree, or manner. Inappropriate organs refers to oral or anal intercourse. An inappropriate place is in the proximity of a guru, temple, stupa, or large gathering. Inappropriate times are those when lay precepts are being observed, during pregnancy, while the mother is breastfeeding, or during daylight hours. An inappropriate degree is five or more times consecutively. Inappropriate forms of intercourse are the likes of rape and anal or oral intercourse with a person of the same sex or with a hermaphrodite.
post.body_html:
The 12th century Tibetan Buddhist master Gampopa said:

Sexual misconduct has three categories: sex proscribed by family ties, sex proscribed by belonging to someone else, and sex proscribed due to religious factors. The first of these is intercourse with parents, siblings, and so forth [blood relations]. The second is intercourse with someone committed to another person or belonging to a monarch. The third includes five areas of improper intercourse because of organs involved, place, time, degree, or manner. Inappropriate organs refers to oral or anal intercourse. An inappropriate place is in the proximity of a guru, temple, stupa, or large gathering. Inappropriate times are those when lay precepts are being observed, during pregnancy, while the mother is breastfeeding, or during daylight hours. An inappropriate degree is five or more times consecutively. Inappropriate forms of intercourse are the likes of rape and anal or oral intercourse with a person of the same sex or with a hermaphrodite.

parent.body:
Don't believe it, post a picture holding a piece of paper with my username for evidence. 

However, your probable lies aside, i will give you some sympathy for the scenario of being bad at everything you like because that is my situation. I'm not good at anything but i have to pass the time somehow... but i can't tell anyone around me about my interests because i suck.  

Yes, i like to play video games, no, i'm not at world tournament levels.

yes, i like to write for my own amusement. No, i'm not writing new york times best sellers that will get a netflix series. 

yes, i like to play board games. No, i'm not a russian grandmaster at chess. 

people are so annoying, the internet ruined society. Now that we are blasted everyday with the most extreme of every activity; nobody is impressed except by the top 1% of the 1%.

post.body: You did it first. The religious baker who wanted to be left alone, you just had to attack him and scream in his face and force him to bend to your demands. Maybe, just maybe, they wouldn't associate such negative attributes with gays if you didn't constantly shove it in their face. No, *you* pushed them over the edge, to scorning it and now to wanting to criminalize it. No one hated black people until you who falsely speak for them burned and looted Minneapolis for days straight. Thanks to *you*, now they really are racist, because you made them think this is what black people do. Maybe they wouldn't be so uncomfortable with trans people if it weren't for you fighting mostly for access to the womens' bathroom for people who still have a penis, athletes blatantly cheating by switching to the weaker team, and unbelievable college snowflakes freaking out about because someone dared "assume their gender". And then you pushed it even further, and now you've got them insisting that everyone follow defined gender roles and wanting to repeal the 19th. Maybe they would even be willing to get along you, but you said no, and there's definitely no going back now. Think about it, if a bunch of crazy people are constantly screaming about something relentlessly, you're going to start loathing said thing, even if you otherwise would've loved it. And those crazy people are what you are. Good job, you've managed to turn half the country against everything it once believed in to destroy you and everything you've made them associate with you. But hey, at least you can pull out your precious victim card, which was probably the plan all along!

body: Well envy was probably the better word. post.body: You did it first. The religious baker who wanted to be left alone, you just had to attack him and scream in his face and force him to bend to your demands. Maybe, just maybe, they wouldn't associate such negative attributes with gays if you didn't constantly shove it in their face. No, *you* pushed them over the edge, to scorning it and now to wanting to criminalize it. No one hated black people until you who falsely speak for them burned and looted Minneapolis for days straight. Thanks to *you*, now they really are racist, because you made them think this is what black people do. Maybe they wouldn't be so uncomfortable with trans people if it weren't for you fighting mostly for access to the womens' bathroom for people who still have a penis, athletes blatantly cheating by switching to the weaker team, and unbelievable college snowflakes freaking out about because someone dared "assume their gender". And then you pushed it even further, and now you've got them insisting that everyone follow defined gender roles and wanting to repeal the 19th. Maybe they would even be willing to get along you, but you said no, and there's definitely no going back now. Think about it, if a bunch of crazy people are constantly screaming about something relentlessly, you're going to start loathing said thing, even if you otherwise would've loved it. And those crazy people are what you are. Good job, you've managed to turn half the country against everything it once believed in to destroy you and everything you've made them associate with you. But hey, at least you can pull out your precious victim card, which was probably the plan all along!

post.body:
There are two Halloweens, a wholesome one where you take kids Trick-or-Treating and an adult one where college students dress up in slutty costumes and get wasted. We don't take kids to the second Halloween, so why would anyone bring them to the "adult" Pride event?

It could be a big picnic at the park where you listen to Elton John or something.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.body:
1 Corinthians 6:9-10
Or do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor men who practice homosexuality, nor thieves, nor the greedy, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

Additionally,

Luke 6:27-31
But I say to you who hear, Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you, bless those who curse you, pray for those who abuse you. To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either. Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back. And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.

Luke 6:32-36
If you love those who love you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them. And if you do good to those who do good to you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners do the same. And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to get back the same amount. But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil. Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
post.body_html:
1 Corinthians 6:9-10 Or do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor men who practice homosexuality, nor thieves, nor the greedy, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

Additionally,

Luke 6:27-31 But I say to you who hear, Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you, bless those who curse you, pray for those who abuse you. To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either. Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back. And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.

Luke 6:32-36 If you love those who love you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them. And if you do good to those who do good to you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners do the same. And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to get back the same amount. But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil. Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
post.title: 1 Corinthians 6:9-10

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body: Lengthy rather than brief, decided simply posting the base of the post would do a better title.
parent.body_html: Lengthy rather than brief, decided simply posting the base of the post would do a better title.

post.body:
1 Corinthians 6:9-10
Or do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor men who practice homosexuality, nor thieves, nor the greedy, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

Additionally,

Luke 6:27-31
But I say to you who hear, Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you, bless those who curse you, pray for those who abuse you. To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either. Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back. And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.

Luke 6:32-36
If you love those who love you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them. And if you do good to those who do good to you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners do the same. And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to get back the same amount. But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil. Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
post.body_html:
1 Corinthians 6:9-10 Or do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor men who practice homosexuality, nor thieves, nor the greedy, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

Additionally,

Luke 6:27-31 But I say to you who hear, Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you, bless those who curse you, pray for those who abuse you. To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either. Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back. And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.

Luke 6:32-36 If you love those who love you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them. And if you do good to those who do good to you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners do the same. And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to get back the same amount. But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil. Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
post.title: 1 Corinthians 6:9-10
